programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn follows his family's roots by exploring Metroland, the area around the Metropolitan Railway, and in Great Malvern learns about the woman behind a decorative 1860s station.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: The Branch Davidians refuse to surrender, while David Koresh waits for a sign from God and his followers are tested by a lack of food and medicine.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: The end of the stalemate seems to approach as the FBI's tactical division turns up the heat.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: Attorneys visit David Koresh and his followers to discuss the case at hand and options. However, the stand-off at the Mount Carmel compound ultimtely comes to a violent and tragic end. Taylor Kitsch and Michael Shannon star.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Jonathan Ross and Frank Skinner, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Vast gold resources lie among south east Asia's island rivers, but they are also home to crocodiles, and locals need the help of professional to extract the valuable ore.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.sub-title: Lost Treasure of the Grand Canyon
programme.desc: Strange spots near the Grand Canyon may lead to the legendary treasure of a notorious bandit. Plus, a massive chunk of ice disappears in Antarctica.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: Space Shuttle Tribute Bike - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team heads to the Johnson Space Centre in Houston, where it reveals the bike dedicated to Nasa and the Discovery space shuttle astronauts.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: How the US has played a major role in protecting Western Europe since the First World War.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Pennsylvania to make bologna, starting by cutting off fat and clots from the meat, packing it and getting it ready for the smokehouse.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of the origins of the Chevrolet Camaro, which first went on sale in 1966 to compete with Ford's Mustang.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the Porsche Panamera, revealing the inner workings and gorgeous exterior.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The case of a man who staged his wife's suicide in a bid to cash in on her life insurance policy, but was caught out by modern forensic technology.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Louise Dickey is discovered brutally murdered in a bath of her own blood, police were stumped. However, nearby surveillance cameras may lead to the shocking truth.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of retired teacher Margaret Jack Sliger, shot dead in her farmyard in Mooresburg in May 2015. Kyle Robert Wolfe, a 15-year-old boy, later pleaded guilty to the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI tries to bring fugitive Charles Moses to justice after he murders a Nebraskan farmer and trieds to kill two police officers.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Max Mixson visits a house where more than 100 dogs are reportedly being confined in miserable conditions, but is given an angry reception by the owner.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa Chimes is under pressure to help a puppy that has been trampled on by its owner, while Dr Chris Brown travels to Adelaide to check on an extremely aggressive Peccary.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kelly looks for a red dress for her wedding, while Beth decides to avoid traditional white gowns in favour of something black.
